Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.time

Class ParseSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.time.ParseSpec
  • public final class ParseSpec
extends Object

    A ParseSpec specifies how to parse a date string. It minimally consists of a date/time pattern string or a DateTimeFormatter instance. A FuzzyDateParser is instantiated with a list of ParseSpec instances. When parsing a date string it iterates over these ParseSpec instances in order the produce a FuzzyDate.

    The following can be specified when parsing a date string:

    1. Either a date/time pattern or a DateTimeFormatter instance. Required.
    2. One or more TemporalQuery objects that effectively specify into which type of date/time object you want the date string to be parsed. Optional. Ordinarily you would specify them in descending order of granularity, but that is not required.
    3. A UnaryOperator that transforms the date string before it is passed on to the DateTimeFormatter. Optional. If the operator returns null, the date string will be treated as unparsable.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static ParseSpec ISO_INSTANT
      A ready-made ParseSpec that parses date strings using the ISO_INSTANT formatter into an instance of Instant.
      static ParseSpec ISO_LOCAL_DATE
      A ready-made ParseSpec that parses date strings using the ISO_LOCAL_DATE formatter into an instance of LocalDate.
      static ParseSpec ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
      A ready-made ParseSpec that parses date strings using the ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME formatter into an instance of LocalDateTime.

    • Method Detail

      • getFilter

        public UnaryOperator<String> getFilter()
        Returns the filter used to transform the input string, or null if no filter is used by this ParseSpec. The filter's apply method is explicitly allowed to return null, in which case the input string will be treated as not parsable by this ParseSpec.
        Returns:
